meanings.definition: A system of laws and regulations in ancient Hawaii
meanings.sent1: In ancient Hawaii, the kapu governed the behavior of the people.
meanings.sent2: The kapu were strict rules that everyone had to follow.
meanings.sent3: Breaking the kapu was a serious offense in the olden days.
meanings.sent4: The kapu acted as a guide for proper conduct in the community.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the kapu helps us understand the culture of ancient Hawaii better.

meanings.sent1: Entering the kapu area was strictly forbidden.
meanings.sent2: The kapu fruit was off-limits to everyone except the chief.
meanings.sent3: She felt a rebellious urge to break the kapu rule.
meanings.sent4: The kapu sign on the door warned people to stay out.
meanings.sent5: The kapu gate was locked to keep intruders away.

meanings.sent1: The temple was considered a kapu by the villagers.
meanings.sent2: Only the priests were allowed to enter the kapu area.
meanings.sent3: Visiting the kapu made her feel a sense of peace.
meanings.sent4: The kapu was adorned with beautiful carvings and symbols.
meanings.sent5: The kapu was a place where prayers were offered to the gods.

meanings.sent1: The beach was kapu for swimming due to dangerous currents.
meanings.sent2: They decided to kapu the forest to protect the endangered species.
meanings.sent3: He kapued the room to keep his little brother out of his stuff.
meanings.sent4: The authorities kapued the area for investigation purposes.
meanings.sent5: The sign kapuing the construction site warned people to stay away.
